model_solution:
To compute the determinant, we will expand along the first row. 

\[ \begin{vmatrix} 2 & 0 & -1 \\ 7 & 4 & -3 \\ 2 & 2 & 5 \end{vmatrix} = 2 \begin{vmatrix} 4 & -3 \\ 2 & 5 \end{vmatrix} - 0 + (-1) \begin{vmatrix} 7 & 4 \\ 2 & 2 \end{vmatrix} \]
Next step: 

Compute the two 2x2 determinants:

\[ \begin{vmatrix} 4 & -3 \\ 2 & 5 \end{vmatrix} = (4)(5) - (-3)(2) = 20 + 6 = 26 \]
\[ \begin{vmatrix} 7 & 4 \\ 2 & 2 \end{vmatrix} = (7)(2) - (4)(2) = 14 - 8 = 6 \]

Then:

\[ \begin{vmatrix} 2 & 0 & -1 \\ 7 & 4 & -3 \\ 2 & 2 & 5 \end{vmatrix} = 2(26) - 0 + (-1)(6) = 52 - 0 - 6 \]
Substitute the values back into the equation: 
\[ \begin{vmatrix} 2 & 0 & -1 \\ 7 & 4 & -3 \\ 2 & 2 & 5 \end{vmatrix} = 52 - 6 = 46 \]
Now that we have the final expression for the determinant, let's simplify it:

\[ \begin{vmatrix} 2 & 0 & -1 \\ 7 & 4 & -3 \\ 2 & 2 & 5 \end{vmatrix} = 52 - 6 = 46 \]

$\boxed{46}$

full_steps:
To compute the determinant, we will expand along the first row. 

\[ \begin{vmatrix} 2 & 0 & -1 \\ 7 & 4 & -3 \\ 2 & 2 & 5 \end{vmatrix} = 2 \begin{vmatrix} 4 & -3 \\ 2 & 5 \end{vmatrix} - 0 + (-1) \begin{vmatrix} 7 & 4 \\ 2 & 2 \end{vmatrix} \]

Next step: 

Compute the two 2x2 determinants:

\[ \begin{vmatrix} 4 & -3 \\ 2 & 5 \end{vmatrix} = (4)(5) - (-3)(2) = 20 + 6 = 26 \]
\[ \begin{vmatrix} 7 & 4 \\ 2 & 2 \end{vmatrix} = (7)(2) - (4)(2) = 14 - 8 = 6 \]

Then:

\[ \begin{vmatrix} 2 & 0 & -1 \\ 7 & 4 & -3 \\ 2 & 2 & 5 \end{vmatrix} = 2(26) - 0 + (-1)(6) = 52 - 0 - 6 \]

Substitute the values back into the equation: 
\[ \begin{vmatrix} 2 & 0 & -1 \\ 7 & 4 & -3 \\ 2 & 2 & 5 \end{vmatrix} = 52 - 6 = 46 \]

Now that we have the final expression for the determinant, let's simplify it:

\[ \begin{vmatrix} 2 & 0 & -1 \\ 7 & 4 & -3 \\ 2 & 2 & 5 \end{vmatrix} = 52 - 6 = 46 \]

$\boxed{46}$
